text:
Selections
U17 World Cup: France in the quarterfinals
The Bleuets impressed at the U17 World Cup 2019. They won on the large score of 4-0 against the Australian and this success consolidates the last three games since the start of the competition.
07 Nov 2019, 11:05 by Nils Constant



10- Chelsea (1996-2019) - Number of players: 13- Cumulative selections: 362Icon Sport



9- FC Nantes (1965-2004) - Number of players: 38- Cumulative selections: 362Icon Sport



8- Stade de Reims (1942-1975) - Number of players: 29- Cumulative selections: 385Icon Sport



7- AS Saint-Etienne (1937-2015) - Number of players: 57- Cumulative selections: 521Icon Sport



6- Arsenal (1997-2018) - Number of players: 17- Cumulative selections: 524Icon Sport



5- Girondins de Bordeaux (1942-2013) - Number of players: 59- Cumulative selections: 533Icon Sport



4- AS Monaco (1953-2019) - Number of players: 67- Cumulative selections: 545Icon Sport



3- Olympique Lyonnais (1951-2019) - Number of players: 58- Cumulative selections: 558Icon Sport



2- Paris Saint-Germain (1970-2019) - Number of players: 55- Cumulative selections: 577Icon Sport



1- Olympique de Marseille (1923-2019) - Number of players: 81- Cumulative selections: 774Icon Sport

Team of France: the top 10 most represented clubs among the Blues





This national squad made a sensational debut in the group stage with seven goals scored and only one conceded before Australia's reception.
This Wednesday, November 6 in Goi√¢nia in Brazil, the young French have again shown their power and efficiency. From the height of their youth, they have the only training to have not suffered a single defeat with the host country. A brilliant success that underlines the good performance of the team.




Large success




Jean-Claude Giuntini - U17 + 10 coach üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

This broad success opened the door to the quarterfinals for the national team. At the top of Group C, France is flying over this competition. They beat Chile (2-0), South Korea (1-3), Haiti (0-2) and finally Australia. Jean-Claude Giuntini, the coach of this France team saw the young Nathanael Mbuku open the scoring from the beginning of the game in the sixth minute before putting a double in the second half (74th and 82nd) and Enzo Millot score the last goal in the 87th.

The tricolores reach the quarterfinals and play against the Spanish selection at the stadium Olympico Pedro-Ludovico Goi√¢nia this Monday, November 11, 2019.
